column4: for your first question, click the home folder icon in the launcher, then File/Connect to server...

for the second problem, launchers just point to desktop files, so if you save the .desktop file to ~/.local/share/applications, you can edit it with a text editor and then drag and drop it back to the launcher
or if you install gnome-panel, you can use: gnome-desktop-item-edit ~/.local/share/applications/launcher_name.desktop; to use the old gui dialog to edit one
hmm, I don't need unity launcher editor then
where do I find the .desktop file? /usr/share/applications/?
can you give me a /me to test?
what are you trying to do?
unless I start kvirc with en_US.UTF-8, I get weird stuff

in natty, I often had to change the name of a launcher if I edited it in ~/.local/share/applications, otherwise the version in /usr/share/applications would override it (the Name= key in the .desktop file)
I haven't used unity enough in oneiric to know if that is still an issue
do I need to copy it to ~/.local/share/applications?
it is usually a good idea if you are editing it, otherwise updates can wipe out your changes (after editing, drag and drop it back to the panel, or you won't get the new version)
